news.title: Diane Abbott suspended by Labour Party after comments about racism
news.summary: MP Diane Abbott is suspended by the Labour Party pending an investigation, the BBC understands.

news.title: Plans for direct train to Berlin in new UK-Germany treaty
news.summary: It comes as Friedrich Merz makes his first official visit to the UK as German chancellor.

news.title: 16 and 17-year-olds to be able to vote in next general election
news.summary: Other planned changes include expanding voter ID to include bank cards and moving to automatic registration.

news.title: Pope renews call for ceasefire after Israeli strike on Gaza church kills three
news.summary: Israel says it regrets any harm to a religious site or uninvolved civilians after a shell hits the Catholic Church of the Holy Family.

news.title: Nurse confronted trans doctor in 'unacceptable' manner, tribunal hears
news.summary: An NHS manager has said said Sandie Peggie should have raised concerns about sharing facilities in a different way.

news.title: Syria leader vows to protect Druze after sectarian violence prompts Israeli strikes
news.summary: Ahmed al-Sharaa spoke after Israel said it would destroy government forces it accused of attacking Druze in Syria.

news.title: Meta investors settle $8bn lawsuit with Zuckerberg over Facebook privacy
news.summary: Shareholders accused Meta leaders of damaging the company by allowing repeat violations of Facebook users' privacy.

news.title: Two men framed by corrupt officer decades ago cleared by appeal court
news.summary: Ronald De Souza, who was part of the Stockwell Six, and Errol Campbell, who died in 2004, are cleared.

news.title: UK's most powerful supercomputer comes online
news.summary: The Isambard-AI supercomputer is made fully operational as the government unveils fresh AI plans.

news.title: Where the England-Sweden quarter-final will be decided
news.summary: Anita Asante breaks down the key battles in England's quarter-final with Sweden at Euro 2025.
